Title.evidence: The TWO Study (Transplantation Without Overimmunosuppression) aimed to investigate a novel approach to regulatory T-cell (Treg) therapy in renal transplant patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Living donor kidney transplant recipients were randomized

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive autologous polyclonal Treg at week 26 posttransplantation, coupled with weaning doses of tacrolimus, (Treg therapy arm) or standard immunosuppression alone (tacrolimus and mycophenolate mofetil)

Objective.evidence: aimed to investigate a novel approach to regulatory T-cell (Treg) therapy in renal transplant patients

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary outcomes were patient survival and rejection-free survival

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomized to receive autologous polyclonal Treg

Number_Randomised.evidence: we report the unique cohort of 7 patients who underwent the original randomized controlled trial protocol

Result_Outcome.evidence: Patient and transplant survival was 100%. Acute rejection-free survival was 100% in the Treg-treated group at 18 mo after transplantation
